StringProperty.Name: LibPath
StringProperty.Description: When looking for tokens files and imported grammars, ANTLR normally looks in the current directory. This option specifies which directory to look in instead. It is only used for resolving grammar references for the import statement and the tokenVocab option. The path to the primary grammar must always be fully specified. List multiple with semi-colon separations.

StringProperty.Name: AntOutDir
StringProperty.Description: Place the generate parser, lexer, and other files in this directory.

BoolProperty.Name: GAtn
BoolProperty.Description: Generate DOT graph files that represent the internal ATN (augmented transition network) data structures that ANTLR uses to represent grammars. The files come out as Grammar.rule .dot. If the grammar is a combined grammar, the lexer rules are named Grammar Lexer.rule .dot.

StringProperty.Name: Encoding
StringProperty.Description: By default ANTLR loads grammar files using the UTF-8 encoding, which is a very common character file encoding that degenerates to ASCII for characters that fit in one byte. There are many character file encodings from around the world. If that grammar file is not the default encoding for your locale, you need this option so that ANTLR can properly interpret grammar files. This does not affect the input to the generated parsers, just the encoding of the grammars themselves.

BoolProperty.Name: Listener
BoolProperty.Description: This option tells ANTLR to generate a parse tree listener and is the default.

BoolProperty.Name: Visitor
BoolProperty.Description: ANTLR does not generate parse tree visitors by default. This option turns that feature on. ANTLR can generate both parse tree listeners and visitors; this option and -listener aren’t mutually exclusive.

StringProperty.Name: Package
StringProperty.Description: Use this option to specify a package or namespace for ANTLR-generated files. Alternatively, you can add a @header {...} action but that ties the grammar to a specific language. If you use this option and @header, make sure that the header action does not contain a package specification otherwise the generated code will have two of them.

StringProperty.Name: DOptions
StringProperty.Description: Explicitly specifies the grammar's target language. If set, this property overrides any value specified within the grammar itself. Note, other options are superClass, contextSuperClass, TokenLableType, tokenVocab, accessLevel, exportMacro. Use ';' as separation character between options.

BoolProperty.Name: Error
BoolProperty.Description: As part of a large build, ANTLR warning messages could go unnoticed. Turn on this option to have warnings treated as errors, causing the ANTLR tool to report failure back to the invoking commandline shell.

BoolProperty.Name: ForceAtn
BoolProperty.Description: ANTLR normally builds traditional “switch on token type” decisions where possible (one token of lookahead is sufficient to distinguish between all alternatives in a decision). To force even these simple decisions into the adaptive LL(*) mechanism, use this option.

StringProperty.Name: JavaDownloadDirectory
StringProperty.DisplayName: Full path of folder contained decompressed JRE.
StringProperty.Description: This is the full path of the location to store decompressed JREs. The default is USERPROFILE/.jre, which gets expanded to a path in the user's home directory for the OS.

StringProperty.Name: JavaExec
StringProperty.Description: This is a search path or full path of java installed on your system. The default is blank, which means to download an install a copy of the latest Java for the build.

StringProperty.Name: AntlrToolJar
StringProperty.DisplayName: Full path of the jar file that contains the Antlr tool.
StringProperty.Description: This is the full path of the jar for Antlr installed on your system. If blank, the version of the Antlr4.Runtime.Standard used.

BoolProperty.Name: AllowAntlr4cs
BoolProperty.Description: Allow both Antlr4.Runtime and Antlr4.Runtime.Standard packages to be referenced.

DynamicEnumProperty.Name: {}{ItemType}
DynamicEnumProperty.Description: How the file relates to the build and deployment processes.

EnumProperty.Name: CopyToOutputDirectory
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies the source file will be copied to the output directory.

StringProperty.Name: Generator
StringProperty.Description: Specifies the tool that transforms a file at design time and places the output of that transformation into another file. For example, a dataset (.xsd) file comes with a default custom tool.

StringProperty.Name: Identity
StringProperty.Description: The item specified in the Include attribute.

StringProperty.Name: FileNameAndExtension
StringProperty.Description: Name of the file or folder.

StringProperty.Name: LastGenOutput
StringProperty.Description: The filename of the last file generated as a result of the SFG.

BoolProperty.Name: DesignTime
BoolProperty.Description: A value indicating whether this file has a designer.

BoolProperty.Name: AutoGen
BoolProperty.Description: A value indicating whether this is a generated file.

StringProperty.Name: CustomTool
StringProperty.Description: DTE Property for accessing the Generator property.
